text: I guess the Python solution I've been relying on is using matplotlib + joblib which works out of the box and doesn't require changing any existing code. Looking for a Julia solution, I've tried parallel plotting with Plots.jl using Distributed, Dagger.jl, and FLoops.jl but can't seem to find a fast and easy way to do it.

text: I am plotting a graph with `plot` and then add several more lines with `plot!` . I want to use a color-blind friendly color palette, so instead of getting first a blue line, then green, then red, the lines would appear with different colors. I played around with the keywords `c` and `palette` , but all i achieved was that each line looked exactly the same, somewhat like a rainbow, consisting of all colors in the pallette. What's the correct way to do this?
